result.heading: THE PERKS OF BEING A WALLFLOWER

direction.raw_text: a WALLFLOWER Written by Stephen Chbosky Final Draft FADE IN: 1   EXT. TUNNEL - NIGHT                                             1 The titles begin over black. We hear the sound of an old typewriter. Someone reaching out to us. The bell dings, announcing the end of a line, and we see our title... THE PERKS OF BEING A WALLFLOWER Music begins, picture fades up, and we are in the city. Downtown Pittsburgh. Looking out of the back window like a child in the back of a station wagon. We see lights on buildings and everything that makes us wonder. We see the bridge. And the river below. And then we enter... The Tunnel. We keep moving backwards, watching the lights. Golden, alive, and hypnotic. The music carries us as we float out of the tunnel. Onto another bridge. And over the highway. We move into the night sky, back through the trees, through a window, and into... 2   INT. CHARLIE'S BEDROOM - NIGHT                                  2 It is a neat and tidy little room. Few posters or books. CHARLIE is 15. He is innocent, hopeful, awkward, and likable to everyone but his classmates. He sits at his desk, writing a letter in pencil as he tapes the title song through the radio on his cassette boom box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dear Friend, I am writing to you because she said you listen and understand and didn't try to sleep with that person at that party even though you could have. Please don't try to figure out who she is because then you might figure out who I am, and I don't want you to do that. I just need to know that people like you exist. Like if you met me, you wouldn't think I was the weird kid who spent time in the hospital. And I wouldn't make you nervous. 3   INT. CHARLIE'S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER                            3 Charlie anxiously walks through the hallway of his suburban split level house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope it's okay for me to think that. You see, I haven't really talked to anyone outside of my family all summer. Charlie moves to the living room where dad watches a football game. Mom reads a page turner and sips her white wine. Charlie waits for them to notice him. And waits. And waits. 4   INT. CHARLIE'S BEDROOM - NIGHT                                      4 Charlie sits at his desk, continuing his letter in pencil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But tomorrow is my first day of high school ever, and I really need to turn things around this year. (hopeful) So, I have a plan. 5   INT. MILL GROVE HIGH SCHOOL HALLWAY - LAST DAY                      5 We see it in Charlie's mind. Slow motion and wondrous. The kids clear out their lockers by throwing their old papers in the air like a New York confetti parade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As I enter the school for the first time, I will visualize what it will be like on the last day of my senior year. Charlie walks down the hall.   Triumphant.   Confident.   Happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unfortunately, I counted, and that's...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 6   INT. MILL GROVE HIGH SCHOOL HALLWAY - FIRST DAY                     6 Reality. The bell rings, and we see the chaotic maze from Charlie's POV. A SENIOR BULLY leads the ritual, making dozens of freshmen hop down the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hop, freshman toads. Hop!    Move it, boys! As seniors grab more victims, Charlie moves to the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... 1,385 days from now. VARSITY FOOTBALL PLAYERS pass, wearing their letter jackets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, you got big.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Worked out all summer.   Rock hard, dude. At the front of the pack is BRAD HAYS (17), the quarterback. He's good looking, charismatic, and friendly. The big man on campus. Nice guy, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you guys get a room? They laugh. Charlie turns to the trophy case to avoid them. Trying to make himself as small as possible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (trying to be optimistic) Just 1,385 days. 7   INT. MILL GROVE HIGH SCHOOL - CAFETERIA - LUNCH                  7 Charlie moves down the lunch line with his sister. CANDACE KELMECKIS is 17 and a beautiful type A, straight A priss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the meantime, I'd hoped that my sister Candace and her boyfriend Derek would have let me eat lunch with their earth club.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seniors only. (barks to Derek) What are you doing with a plastic spork? Candace turns to her boyfriend, DEREK, 17. Derek is such a pussy, the most masculine thing about him is his pony-tail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to bring back silverware--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Derek, you're Earth Club Treasurer. Derek takes the silverware like a beaten dog. Charlie watches them move into the intimidating cafeteria. 8   INT. CAFETERIA - LATER                                           8 Charlie sits in the corner alone, observing everyone having a great time with their friends. He sees a pretty girl with blonde hair having the best first day. This is SUSAN, 14.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When my sister said no, I thought maybe my old friend Susan would want to have lunch with me. Charlie catches her eye and waves, but she looks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In middle school, Susan was very fun to be around, but now she doesn't like to say hi to me anymore. Charlie turns his attention to the quarterback, Brad Hays.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then there's Brad Hays, who's the quarterback of our team. Before my brother went to play football for Penn State, he and Brad played together. So, I thought maybe he'd say hi to me. But Brad's a senior, and I'm me, so... who am I kidding? Brad catches Charlie staring at him.   Awkward. 9   INT. SHOP CLASS - DAY                                           9 Charlie sits by himself, watching the freshmen boys laugh as a senior paints a goatee on his face with a grease pencil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the bright side, one senior decided to make fun of the teacher instead of the freshmen. He even drew on Mr. Callahan's legendary goatee with a grease pencil. Meet PATRICK (18), full of confidence, mischief, and so over high school. He is the class clown, performing a perfect imitation of the teacher, Mr. Callahan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boys, the prick punch is not a toy. I learned that in 'Nam back in '68. "Callahan," the sergeant said, "put down that prick punch and go kill some gooks." The laughter suddenly dies as the real MR. CALLAHAN (57) walks up behind the oblivious Patrick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you know what happened? That prick punch killed my best friend in a Saigon whorehouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Patrick suddenly feels Mr. Callahan behind him.   Oops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard you were going to be in my class. Are you proud being a senior taking freshman shop, Patty-Cakes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name is Patrick. You call me Patrick or you call me nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... Nothing. The class laughs. Except Charlie.   He watches Patrick take the long walk back to his seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I felt really bad for Patrick. He wasn't saying the impersonation to be mean or anything. He was just trying to make us freshmen feel better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone open your safety guides. Nothing... why don't you read first? Patrick opens the book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chapter 1. Surviving your fascist shop teacher, who needs to put kids down to feel big. (to the class) Oh, wow. This is useful guys. We should read on. Charlie smiles.   He loves him already. 10   INT. ENGLISH CLASS - MORNING                                    10 The kids pass back paperback copies of To Kill A Mockingbird. Charlie opens his Trapper Keeper, takes a pencil out of the plastic pouch, and writes... "ENGLISH CLASS... DAY ONE."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My last class of the day is advanced English, and I'm excited to finally start learning with the smartest kids in the school... A SMART ASS FRESHMAN girl with braces smiles at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispers) Nice Trapper Keeper, faggot. The kids around him laugh. Charlie's ears turn red. At the blackboard, the teacher writes his name... Mr. Anderson. But you can call him BILL (27). Bill is an idealist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shhh. I'm Mr. Anderson. And thanks to Teach for America, I'm going to be your teacher for freshman English. This semester, we're going to be learning Harper Lee's To Kill a Mockingbird. Genius book. Now, who wants to get out of the first pop quiz? All hands go up.   Except Charlie's.   Bill paces the rows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm shocked. Alright. You can skip the quiz if you tell me which author invented the paperback book. Anyone? As kids think, Bill confiscates contraband, removes hats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's British. He also invented the serial. In fact, at the end of chapter 3 of his first novel, he had a man hanging off a cliff by his fingernails. Hence, the term cliffhanger. Anybody?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shakespeare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a great guess, but no, Shakespeare didn't write novels. Anybody else? (off their silence) The author was... Bill is about to give the answer when he notices Charlie has already written... Charles Dickens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Charles Dickens. However, if you and I had gone to a play in Shakespeare's time, it would have cost 4 pennies. Can you imagine that? We would have put those pennies in a metal box, which the ushers would lock in the office. And that's where we get the term... anyone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Office Depot!" "Office Supplies!" Charlie writes down Box Office, then looks up to find that Bill is staring at him. Waiting for him to raise his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll give you a free "A" on anything but the final term paper if you get it right. Charlie looks down.   He's not going to answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Box office. The kids groan. They should have known.     Charlie smiles to himself. He's going to like this class. 11   INT. ENGLISH CLASS - LATER                                      11 The bell rings. The students chatter their way out of class. The last to leave is Charlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should learn to participate. Charlie stops and turns to find Bill erasing the board.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you raise your hand? (off Charlie's shrug) They call you teacher's pet? Freak? (off Charlie's nod) I used to get spaz. I mean, come on, spaz? Charlie smiles.   Bill takes a moment.   Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, I heard you had a tough time last year. But they say if you make one friend on your first day, you're doing okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, sir, but if my English teacher is the only friend I make today, that would be sort of depressing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.   I could see that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, Mr. Anderson.     I'm okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Bill nods and watches Charlie exit.   He gets swallowed up by the hallway as the bell rings. 12   INT. MILL GROVE HIGH SCHOOL - HALLWAY - DAY                     12 Charlie looks through the thick office glass. He sees Patrick use his charms on MRS. SMALL, (58) the Principal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Mrs. Small) I would happily not take shop... Out of nowhere, the SENIOR BULLY grabs Charlie's book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Freshman Toad. The bully rips the cover. He throws it on the ground as his friends laugh and disappear down the hall. Charlie walks up and picks up his book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I have 1,384 days to go. And just so I say it to someone, high school is even worse than middle school. 13   EXT. CHARLIE'S HOUSE - DAY                                      13 Charlie walks up the path to his house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If my parents ask me about it, I probably won't tell them the truth because I don't want them to worry that I might get bad again. 14   INT. CHARLIE'S HOUSE - AFTERNOON                                14 Charlie tapes his book cover back together. He looks up as his dad comes home from a long day. Charlie's mom hugs him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If my Aunt Helen were still here, I could talk to her. And I know she would understand how I am both happy and sad, and I'm still trying to figure out how that could be. I just hope I make a friend soon. Love always, Charlie. 15   INT. CHARLIE'S DINING ROOM - EARLY EVENING                      15 Charlie stands in the kitchen, pouring his milk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie, come on. His family is seated around the table.    Candace's boyfriend, Derek, is their special guest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mmmm. This chicken paprikash is delicious, Mrs. Kelmeckis. Charlie's father rolls his eyes, then reads his sports page.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Derek. It's Charlie's favorite. He was a little nervous about starting high school, so I made it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You feel a little silly being nervous now, huh, champ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.    I sure do. Charlie carries his milk back to the table.   He quickly sits, hoping someone will change the subject.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you. Just give 'em a smile and be yourself. That's how you--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "--make friends in the real world."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're cruisin' for a bruisin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freshman year is tough, but you really find yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (deep eye roll) Thanks, Derek. 16   INT. LIVING ROOM / ENTRY HALL - EVENING                          16 Charlie's father and mother watch a local sports show. Charlie passes by them with ice cream on his way downstairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you could be a little nicer to Derek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.     The kid's a pussy.   I can't stand him. Charlie moves to the entry hall. He looks through the screen door to the porch where Candace kisses Derek's cheek goodbye. As Derek walks to his mom's Mercedes, Candace joins Charlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (waving from car) I hope you love the mix I made.     The cover is hand-painted. When he gets into his car, she hands Charlie the mix tape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie, do you want this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gives me one every week. 17   INT. CHARLIE'S BED ROOM - DUSK                                      17 Charlie sits on his bed, reading To Kill a Mockingbird, the cover taped back together. We see Derek's mix... Autumn Leaves... rotate in his old tape recorder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Babe. This next one might be a little sad, but it reminded me of your eyes. The first notes of The Smiths' "Asleep" begins.     As Morrissey sings, Charlie keeps reading. And reading.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 18   INT. CHARLIE'S BEDROOM - DAY                                        18 The reading is done. Charlie proudly puts To Kill a Mockingbird on his newly dubbed "Shelf of Fame." 19   INT. MILL GROVE HIGH SCHOOL - HALLWAY - AFTERNOON                   19 The songs continues as we see glimpses of Charlie's day to day life over the next few weeks. Charlie exits his English class. FRESHMEN BULLIES wait for him, led by...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you already do the term paper on To
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Silence. They grab and drag him into the boy's room.     We hear the toilet flush for the swirly. 20   INT. CHARLIE'S BEDROOM - DUSK                                       20 Charlie looks at the new bottle of prescription Wellbutrin. He puts a pill in his mouth and washes it down with RC cola. 21   INT. CHARLIE'S LIVING ROOM - AFTERNOON                              21 Charlie watches his brother and the Penn State Nittany Lions on TV. He looks over at his father, but his dad is too busy building Charlie's clock for shop class to notice him. 22   INT. MILL GROVE HIGH SCHOOL - CAFETERIA - LUNCH                     22 Charlie carries his tray through the intimidating cafeteria. Not giving up. Looking for somewhere to sit. CUT TO: 23   INT. MILL GROVE HIGH SCHOOL - CAFETERIA - LUNCH                     23 Charlie sits by himself in the corner. He looks around the cafeteria, wanting to break in. Not knowing how. After a moment, he returns to his book. The song ends. 24   EXT. MILL GROVE HIGH SCHOOL - FOOTBALL STADIUM - NIGHT              24 Friday Night Football in Western, PA. Charlie buys his Coke and nachos and wanders to the bleachers. He sits alone, trying to blend in by cheering with the rest of students. When the Mill Grove Devils recover a fumble, he hears...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on Devils! Woooooo! Charlie looks up at Patrick, cheering his head off.    TWIN SENIOR GIRLS pass him, taunting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Nothing. Hey, Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suck it, virginity pledges! Charlie wants to go up to Patrick so badly. After driving himself crazy, sitting up and down twice, he approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey... Patrick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! You're in my shop class, right? How's your clock coming?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My dad's building it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Mine looks like a boat. (off Charlie's awkward silence) You want to sit over here, or are you waiting for your friends?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.   I'll sit if that's okay. Patrick motions for Charlie to sit.   Charlie sits.   Elated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for not calling me "Nothing" by the way. It's an endless nightmare. And these assholes actually think they're being original. Brad Hays puts on his helmet and rushes onto the field. Charlie dries his hands on his pants. So nervous. A 5 second silence that feels like a year. Think of something to say. Anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, uh... you like football?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Love it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then, maybe you know my broth--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Sam. Charlie looks up. Standing there is the prettiest girl he's ever seen. SAM (17) would make every mother proud and every father nervous. She is alive, adventurous, and a world class flirt. Great attitude. Great taste. Great banter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Question. Could the bathrooms here be more disgusting?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, they call it the men's room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Sam sits down, sandwiching Charlie between her and Patrick. Charlie tries to remain casual. Hang in there, buddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I finally got hold of Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Party tonight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. He's still trying to shag that waitress from the Olive Garden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's never tossing that salad. Brad Hays marches the Devils offense down the field. The kids clap. Sam looks at Charlie, then turns back to Patrick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (about Charlie) Patrick... who's this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... Charlie... Kelmeckis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelmeckis! No shit! Your sister dates Pony Tail Derek, doesn't she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that what they call him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Awww. Leave Pony Tail Derek alone.    You put the "ass" in "class," Patrick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I try, Sam. I try.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's nice to meet you, Charlie.    I'm Sam. Sam extends her hand to Charlie. Every nail a different color. They shake. Then, Sam grabs a nacho. Zoinks!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, what's the plan, Sam? You want to go to Mary Elizabeth's house?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't. She got caught watering down her parent's brandy with iced tea. Let's just go to Kings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turns to Charlie) Hey... we're going to Kings after the game if you want to come. Charlie nods just as Brad Hays tosses a touchdown pass.   The fans go crazy. Especially Patrick. Charlie smiles. 25   INT. KINGS FAMILY RESTAURANT - NIGHT                             25 The Devils' faithful cheer as Brad Hays and his guys enter! The place is packed. Patrick and Sam drink coffee while Charlie eats his brownie. They're all excited.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have a favorite band?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think The Smiths are my favorite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you kidding!? I love The Smiths! The best breakup band ever. What's your favorite song?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Asleep. It's from Louder Than Bombs. I heard it on Pony Tail Derek's mix tape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That works on so many levels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could make a copy for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. What about Eide's?     You love Eide's, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (never heard of it) Yeah. They're great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not a band, Charlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's an old record store downtown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I used to be popular before Sam got me some good music. So, watch out, Charlie. She'll ruin your life forever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's okay. Brad Hays, the quarterback, passes with his posse.       Taunting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Nothing. Hey, Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let it go!     Jesus!   It's an old joke! It's over! Sam laughs.   She loves watching Patrick get riled up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, Charlie... what are you going to do when you get out of here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My Aunt Helen said I should be a writer, but I don't know what I'd write about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You could write about us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Call it Slut and The Falcon.      Make us solve crimes. Sam laughs.   Charlie smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys look happy together. How long have you been boyfriend and girlfriend? (off their laughs) What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's my step-brother. My mom finally left my worthless dad and married his nice dad 3 years ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Sam's not bitter.     Make no mistake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely. I'm not a bulimic.      I'm a bulim-ist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They laugh at their inside joke.    Charlie has no idea what's so funny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.     I don't know what that means.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She just really believes in bulimia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cracking up) I love bulimia. 26   EXT. CHARLIE'S HOUSE - NIGHT                                      26 Charlie hops out of Sam's old truck.    The music blares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for paying, Charlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (so eager) No problem. Thanks for the ride. Hey... maybe I'll see you around in school?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (distracted - to Patrick) God, would you turn that down? You're going to make us deaf. Bye, Charlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bye, Charlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.   Bye. Charlie waves as the truck leaves. The look on his face. The happiness from one night of company. 27   INT. CHARLIE'S HOUSE - NIGHT                                      27 Charlie enters the house, excited to tell someone his news. He runs up the stairs to find the living room empty. He hears the TV playing downstairs in the basement. 28   INT. DOORWAY TO BASEMENT - NIGHT                                  28 As Charlie approaches, he hears muffled sounds of fighting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. I can't do anything about it. Please talk to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe your mom and I should have a "drive us to our hair appointment" contest. Then, I could spend a Saturday with you. Charlie looks through a slit in the open door to find...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's nothing I can do--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you always want to be a mama's boy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am not a mama's boy--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes! You are! Every time I go to your house--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shhh.   Shut u--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: your mom says, "Don't go to Columbia with Candace. Go to Pitt, Derek. Mommy needs you to stay at home because she can't drive herself." She's only 51.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! 29   INT. CHARLIE'S HOUSE - BASEMENT - CONTINUOUS                   29 Charlie enters, wanting to stop the fight. Derek's neck is red. Dangerous angry. Candace keeps digging.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you just stand there like a little bitch dog. SNAP! Out of nowhere, Derek slaps her across the face. It's not a movie slap. It's a real slap. Dead sound. And after it, silence. Candace turns and sees Charlie. It sobers her up. Charlie moves at Derek. Candace stops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie, just go. I can handle it.   Just don't wake up mom and dad. She pushes him out of the room and closes the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 30   INT. CHARLIE'S BEDROOM - NIGHT                                       30 Charlie sits at his desk. So disturbed. He hears a car start outside. He moves to his window and looks down at Derek and Candace near Derek's mother's Mercedes. Derek is crying. Candace comforts. After a beat... they kiss. Charlie stands frozen, a look creeping across his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, look who's here...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 31   INT. ENTRY HALL - NIGHT (FLASHBACK)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Welcome home, Aunt Helen!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.   Look at you all, dressed so nice. Aunt Helen smiles at Little Charlie on top of the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 32   INT. ENTRY HALL - NIGHT (PRESENT)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I egged him on. You saw it. He's never hit me before. I promise he'll never hit me again. She's about to go back downstairs when...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like Aunt Helen's boyfriends? A silence passes between them.   Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie... this is Pony Tail Derek.   I can handle him. Will you trust me? Please, don't tell mom and dad. With a desperately confident nod, Candace goes downstairs. Charlie stands in the entry hall, troubled. 33   INT. GYMNASIUM - NIGHT                                          33 The Homecoming Dance is in full swing. God bless everyone. Especially Charlie. He's alone at the wall, dressed in his Sunday suit. To us, adorable. To himself, in living hell. Charlie watches his sister, slow dancing with Derek. As happy as she looks, Charlie still isn't sure if he did the right thing by keeping quiet. The song ends to applause. After a beat, Charlie turns away. That's when he sees Sam and Patrick at the punch bowl. We hear the first notes of "Come On, Eileen" by Dexy's Midnight Runners.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my God. They're playing good music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy shit. They are!   They're playing good music!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even if you didn't know what I was talking about. Or know someone who's gone through it. It made me not feel alone. With Sam's help, Charlie climbs through the little window
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 185   EXT. HIGHWAY 376 NORTH - NIGHT                                   185 Charlie gets into the back of the truck. He sits down, looking back at the highway. Watching everywhere he's been.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I know there are people who say all of these things don't happen. And there are people who forget what it's like to be 16 when they turn 17. We see Charlie in profile.   The night sky behind him until... 186   INT. FORT PITT TUNNEL - NIGHT                                    186 ... they enter the tunnel, and we realize just how fast they're driving. The white tiles of the tunnel whiz by at blinding speed. A perfect night. A perfect drive. Flying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know these will all be stories someday. And our pictures will become old photographs. And we'll all become somebody's mom or dad. But right now, these moments are not stories. Charlie turns to face forward. To the moment.   To Sam, smiling at him from the front seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is happening. I am here. And I am looking at her. And she is so beautiful. Sam kisses Charlie. Then, she turns, and all three kids look ahead to everything in front of them. Charlie begins to stand in the back of the truck. Ready to leave the tunnel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can see it. This one moment when you know you're not a sad story. You are alive. And as you stand up and see the lights on buildings and everything that makes you wonder. And you are listening to that song on that drive with the people you love most in this world. Charlie stands in the back of the truck.   The wind on his face. He is free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And in this moment, I swear...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We see the moment as Charlie sees it. The tunnel's exit getting bigger and brighter with the lights of the city behind it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... we are infinite. The tunnel song blasts over the speakers as the truck flies out of the tunnel. Sam and Patrick scream with excitement. Charlie holds his arms in the air. The weight of the world gone. If only for a moment. This one moment. We see the city. A million lights like white stars in a glass dome. We crane to the sky. We are in Heaven.
direction.name: direction
